numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts how legacy status affects an applicant's chance of acceptance into a school.
3. For an elite school, familial ties to the school can be a major factor in an application.
4. For an elite school, legacy status can increase an applicant's chance of acceptance by about a factor of 7.
5. Some universities are the most prestigious universities.
6. Nearly all students at a most prestigious university are legacy students.
7. I am in the college admissions process.
9. Some universities are Ivy League universities.
10. I am not a legacy at any Ivy League university.
11. My chance of admission to an Ivy League university is very low.
12. I wonder why this kind of bias is still allowed in the decision process.
13. Some legislations were passed in the last few years.
14. These legislations removed race bias from the admissions process.
15. These legislations removed economic bias from the admissions process.
16. These legislations removed standardized-testing bias from the admissions process.
17. Legacy consideration is still used in the admissions process.
19. A possible headline is: How are your chances of getting into Harvard?
